By the King. A proclamation, for restraint of killing, dressing, and eating of flesh in Lent or on fish-days appointed by the law to be observed England and Wales. Sovereign (1660-1685 : Charles II) Charles II, King of England, 1630-1685.
3 sheets.
Printed by John Bill and Christopher Barker ..., [London : 1661]
Title vignette: royal seal with initials C R. Initial letter. Text in black letter. Imprint from colophon. Reproduction of original in: National Library of Scotland.
=======

3 sheets.
Printed by John Bill and Christopher Barker ..., [London : 1661]
Title vignette: royal seal with initials C R. Initial letter. Text in black letter. Imprint from colophon. Reproduction of original in: National Library of Scotland.
